metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript HTML DOM Events
HTML DOM allows JavaScript to react to HTML events:
content.html: HTML DOM allows JavaScript to react to HTML events:

content.text: Reacting to Events
A JavaScript can be executed when an event occurs, like when a user clicks on an HTML element.
content.html: A JavaScript can be executed when an event occurs, like when a user clicks on an HTML element.

content.text: To execute code when a user clicks on an element, add JavaScript code to an HTML event attribute:
content.html: To execute code when a user clicks on an element, add JavaScript code to an HTML event attribute:

content.text: Examples of HTML events:
content.html: Examples of HTML events:

content.text: In this example, the content of the <h1> element is changed when a user clicks on it:
content.html: In this example, the content of the <h1> element is changed when a user clicks on it:

content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h2 onclick="this.innerHTML = 'Ooops!'">Click on this text!</h1>

</body>
</html>

content.text: In this example, a function is called from the event handler:
content.html: In this example, a function is called from the event handler:

content.code: Click on this text!
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h2 onclick="changeText(this)">Click on this text!</h1>

<script>
function changeText(id) {
  id.innerHTML = "Ooops!";
}
</script>

</body>
</html>

content.text: HTML Event Attributes
To assign events to HTML elements you can use event attributes.
content.html: To assign events to HTML elements you can use event attributes.

content.code_html: <button onclick="displayDate()">Try it</button>

content.text: In the example above, a function named displayDate will be executed when the button is clicked.
content.html: In the example above, a function named displayDate will be executed when the button is clicked.

content.text: Assign Events Using the HTML DOM
The HTML DOM allows you to assign events to HTML elements using JavaScript:
content.html: The HTML DOM allows you to assign events to HTML elements using JavaScript:

content.code_html:
<script>
document.getElementById("myBtn").onclick = displayDate;
</script>

content.text: In the example above, a function named displayDate is assigned to an HTML element with the id="myBtn" .
content.html: In the example above, a function named displayDate is assigned to an HTML element with the id="myBtn".

content.text: The function will be executed when the button is clicked.
content.html: The function will be executed when the button is clicked.

content.text: The onload and onunload Events
The onload and onunload events are triggered when the user enters or leaves the page.
content.html: The onload and onunload events are triggered when the user enters or leaves the page.

content.text: The onload event can be used to check the visitor's browser type and browser version, and load the proper version of the web page based on the information.
content.html: The onload event can be used to check the visitor's browser type and browser version, and load the proper version of the web page based on the information.

content.text: The onload and onunload events can be used to deal with cookies.
content.html: The onload and onunload events can be used to deal with cookies.

content.code_html: <body onload="checkCookies()">

content.text: The oninput Event
The oninput event is often to some action while the user input data.
content.html: The oninput event is often to some action while the user input data.

content.text: Below is an example of how to use the oninput to change the content of an input field.
content.html: Below is an example of how to use the oninput to change the content of an input field.

content.code_html: <input type="text" id="fname" oninput="upperCase()">

content.text: The onchange Event
The onchange event is often used in combination with validation of input fields.
content.html: The onchange event is often used in combination with validation of input fields.

content.text: Below is an example of how to use the onchange. The upperCase() function will be called when a user changes the content of an input field.
content.html: Below is an example of how to use the onchange. The upperCase() function will be called when a user changes the content of an input field.

content.code_html: <input type="text" id="fname" onchange="upperCase()">

content.text: The onmouseover and onmouseout Events
The onmouseover and onmouseout events can be used to trigger a function when the user mouses over, or out of, an HTML element:
content.html: The onmouseover and onmouseout events can be used to trigger a function when the user mouses over, or out of, an HTML element:

content.text: Try it Yourself »
content.html: Try it Yourself »

content.text: The onmousedown, onmouseup and onclick Events

The onmousedown , onmouseup , and onclick events are all parts of a mouse-click. First when a mouse-button is clicked, the onmousedown event is triggered, then, when the mouse-button is released, the onmouseup event is triggered, finally, when the mouse-click is completed, the onclick event is triggered.
content.html: The onmousedown, onmouseup, and onclick events are all parts of a mouse-click. First when a mouse-button is clicked, the onmousedown event is triggered, then, when the mouse-button is released, the onmouseup event is triggered, finally, when the mouse-click is completed, the onclick event is triggered.

content.code_html: Click Me

content.text: Try it Yourself »
content.html: Try it Yourself »

content.text: More Examples
onmousedown and onmouseup Change an image when a user holds down the mouse button.
content.html:
onmousedown and onmouseup
Change an image when a user holds down the mouse button.

content.text: onload Display an alert box when the page has finished loading.
content.html:
onload
Display an alert box when the page has finished loading.

content.text: onfocus Change the background-color of an input field when it gets focus.
content.html:
onfocus
Change the background-color of an input field when it gets focus.

content.text: Mouse Events Change the color of an element when the cursor moves over it.
content.html:
Mouse Events
Change the color of an element when the cursor moves over it.

content.html: For a list of all HTML DOM events, look at our complete HTML DOM Event Object Reference.
